results.title: His trust; His trust fulfilled
results.brief_description: This melodrama, set during and after the Civil War, is something of a sketch for ‘Birth of a Nation’. Against Griffith’s wishes it was released serially in two parts. In the first part, a faithful black servant, played by a white actor in black face, rescues his master’s child from the burning house. Her father has died fighting for the South. In the second part the old servant after using all his savings, is tempted to steal to pay for the young woman’s education. Cast includes Wilfred Lucas, Claire McDowell, Mack Sennett, Del Henderson, Gladys Egan.

results.title: His Royal Highness
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and F.W. Thring
results.brief_description: George Wallace plays a stage-hand who dreams that he is King. This is Efftee’s third feature and the first all Australian talking musical film. Some lively songs and an ingenious comic performance by George Wallace. Cast also includes Mona Barlee, Marshall Crosby, Lou Vernon.

results.title: His responsibility?
results.brief_description: Ronnie aged 18, learns that his girlfriend is pregnant. Abortion? Illegitimacy? Keeping the baby? Adoption? Marriage? He must decide what his responsibility is. This film helps teenagers preview the consequences of irresponsible actions, as they affect themselves and others.

results.title: His mother's voice
results.brief_description: Based on the transcript of an ABC radio interview, “His Mother’s Voice” is a powerful animated work which asks us to bear witness to the emotional force of tragedy. A mother recounts the details of learning about her son’s fatal shooting. We first hear her words while the images dramatise the events. We then listen to the words again as the animators focus our attention on her face, her moving lips, the boy’s bedroom and the activities of the suburban street on which he lived. The effect is equally mesmerising and devastating.

results.title: His mother's voice
results.brief_description: Using as its source a radio interview from the ABCs current affairs program, The World Today, in which a Queensland mother recounts how she came to learn of her sons shooting in 1995, Dennis Tupicoff explores terrain somewhere between documentary and animation. As an animator he gives an added dimension to the documentary nature of his subject matter by dividing the film into two halves, one an animated re-enactment of the crime, the other an understated lyrical and visual poetic presentation of the overwhelming nature of grief. This short film is both compelling and powerfully affecting.

results.title: His Girl Friday (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Cary Grant is the cheeky news editor, Rosalind Russell is the ace female reporter with printer’s ink in her veins. Amid the frenzy of newsmen competing for that front page story, high energy romance, and Ben Hecht’s famous overlapping dialogue and machine-gun paced script, a reporter about to get married and escape the newsworld, stumbles upon the biggest story of her career - a notorious criminal surrenders personally. One of the funniest and most biting screwball comedies on film. Also stars Ralph Bellamy. Based on the 1928 play “The Front page” by Ben Hecht and Charles MacArthur and a remake of the 1931 Howard Hughes film “The Front page”.
